intro: Calonyction campanulatum, commonly known as the bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Calonyction campanulatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and naturalized areas.
